intro: Dampiera galbraithiana, commonly known as the silver leaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and small, star-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It is often found in coastal regions and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. Dampiera galbraithiana is also valued for its ability to thrive in low-water conditions.
